review_title: There's no better work-life balance. Students make the pay worth it!
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Katy, TX
pros: The work schedule is as flexible as they come. I've never experienced a better work-life balance which has been key with grade school aged kids at home. Students mainly want to take their classes online, so most(but not all) of the work is remote/work from home. Benefits are solid. So while the pay is barely sufficient, it at least pays more than most grade-school/ISD based teaching positions. If you like being a pivotal influence and mentor to others, then it's hard to find a more direct position. You form relationships with students for life and get to celebrate their successes along the way. Regarding the interactions with students, this is the most rewarding job I have ever held.
cons: Historically, lowest pay among peer institutions such as Lonestar College. Don't make the mistake of thinking your only job as an instructor is to teach your classes to the best of your ability. Enrollment rules the world for higher academia. Ironically, more emphasis is put on students' physical attendance in campus classrooms, rather than general enrollment (whether online or in-person) in a program. Key performance indicators for each program of study are dictated by the President of the campus the program is assigned to which means if your program is unlucky and gets assigned to an East Houston based campus, your are screwed, because the geographical mid-point of Houston's population is actually located at Westheimer and Beltway 8. It's obvious students want to take classes online or closest to their homes. Huge emphasis is put on educating HISD dual-credit students, but the highest enrollment of dual-credit is actually with Alief ISD. Teamwork between service departments such as Student Success and Degree programs does not exist, so get ready to be blamed for other people not doing their job or for other departments being understaffed. Unfortunately, administration does not seem to acknowledge the high employee turnover as an indicator of this disfunction, unrealistic KPIs, and lack of ownership by administrations / service departments. We are getting a new Chancellor soon though, so there may be hope for real change to be made in the future.

review_title: Very Low Pay For Faculty and Staff
pros: Decent work schedule, free parking. Sometimes the students are nice.
cons: Higher administration and the Board of Trustees. The BoT hasn’t given us raises in awhile; while all the other colleges around us got Covid bonuses and raises, we got absolutely nothing. We still haven’t gotten a raise this year. Another con is that the students we get usually aren’t prepared to deal with all the administrative stuff around the college, such as where to find resources, how to schedule classes, etc. and no one helps them.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Spring Branch, TX
pros: Flexibility, a lot of opportunities
cons: Very infrequent raises, Too many meetings

pros: The students are great, especially if you have a passion for teaching. Leaving was hard because the students were always engaged and willing to try.
cons: I was not paid for an entire month of work! The payroll department verified that the pay calculation was correct. I do not understand how they expect anyone to work for free, but apparently they do. Being assigned classes was difficult; keeping them was even more difficult. Classes were constantly taken so other professors could “make their load.” Professors are treated as disposable people who fill space - one leaves, another is put in their place. When one of the department heads “interviewed me for 5 minutes and then hired me on the spot, I should have known something was off about HCC. It is nothing more than an employee mill and a money-based institution. Two semesters was all it took for me to see through their scam.

job_title: Higher Education Instructor in Houston, TX
pros: Work is fun with peers, colleagues, and coworkers. We work for the benefit of the students and love what we do. I also tell people the demands and expectations are quite light compared to what I was subjected to in industry. After spending many, many years in industry working long hours and spending many months travelling for work, this is the best work-life balance I have ever had. Benefits are reasonable and job security is very good. Colleagues are always looking out for colleagues and providing mentorship. As long as you are doing the work for the love of the students, not for the pay, then everyday is the best money you have ever made. The appreciation from and accomplishments by the students reaffirm that rewarding work isn't always reflected in the pay.
cons: Administration can be disconnected from the mission and self-centered. Training has to be sought out and self-determined rather than guided and provided. This results in being subjected to bad management and self-centered leadership. HCC is in desperate need of implementing a leadership and management training program. They tend to think that a PhD and teaching experience counts as leadership training, but it's very clear that more targeted training needs to occur. Instead, it requires the ability to manage your manager and organize collective efforts to keep morale up. The pay never really reflects the amount of work and effort you put into the job, but management has a way of pointing the finger at the lowest in the line rather than take accountability for their lack of leadership skills.

pros: Not much to say. I’m looking for a different job so others who I know.

I went to them with the same exact issue because some tutor encourage me to go and I got totally different treatment as he got. They called him and showed him care and because of that  he encounrage me to go too. Basically,  they told me this is what it is , stay or leave. They expect you to travel to different centers in the same semester while they don’t schedule you 19 hours nor giving you any benefits. Not stable a job. They don’t care about job performance and work ethics. They want to have fun.

pros: I would've still been working there.

pros: I loved working with the students.  I found the experience to be ultimately one of the greatest of my lifetime.  To be able to educate, enlighten, encourage,and refine talented stylist that will change how people will think of themselves and others..... enchanting.  It is a job that I would go back to now that I know what to expect.
cons: I did not feel as though I was given proper training as to how the "system" truly works.  So, I spent a great deal of the time playing catch-up.  I honestly believe that part of the problem I had was "the time at which I was Hired".... I was hired a day or 2 before classes started.... so everything that I was given/assigned was rushed.  At the time there were too many politics involved for me, and there was a great likelihood that you could be thrown "under the bus".  No place is perfect.

review_title: Good institution, poor management. Much upside possible
pros: Socially responsible and good for the community. Some excellent professional tied up in a web of mediocrity. There is room to contribute if you follow the guidelines. If not you can be stuck in red tape.
cons: Management is political and very siloed. People think ' me first and getting ahead'. Heard many times "don't speak up" ... other times heard " They treat us like **it" ... "If you want to get ahead, leave!"..."one top manager said, 'i know its wrong, but its the process' ...(can you believe that happening in a private institution?) ... it became unbearable to be in a no man's land where you could not change the system and you could not do what you needed to do because of it. Much inbreeding and people protected each other if they were old school buddies, especially the old timers from  the 90's covered each others back no matter how incompetent or Peter Principled they had become.

review_title: It was bittersweet. Good colleagues and great supervisor but the District has too much drama going on behind the scenes.
pros: Good amount of time off for holidays, breaks and for some campuses a flexible schedule for summer months. Leadership program that the district offers is EXCELLENT! And of course the students! Each campus has their own vibe, culture and personality. So the good news is...if you don't like your campus, you could transfer to another position after a certain amt. of months.
cons: Too much negative press. And it is VERY, VERY political. For it to be one of the largest community colleges in the country, it is not very progressive in terms of best practices etc. In some ways, it appears that the District (not every campus) wants to remain complacent and not necessarily on the cutting edge. Let's just say, more than likely, I will not apply to work there again.

pros: Good benefits, health care is covered by the state. Get all major holidays off, most of the campuses are somewhat laid back depending on the staff.
cons: Salary is not good and not competitive. If you move around in the company they pay you less vs an outsider coming in which doesn’t make much sense. The organization as a whole is very disorganized. No effective communication. Lots of politics going on. Unless you are desperate for a job or need some experience look elsewhere. LoneStar is much better or another college near by. Very all over the place. They promote incompetent people instead of intelligent people who would give the institution better organization. Turn over rate is very high.

pros:
There is a provision in Texas law that allows adjunct faculty to participate in employee benefits.  There is no subsidy of insurance premiums for part-time faculty, but the benefits for the money are often better than you can get on a private policy or through the Affordable Care Act Healthcare Marketplace.

I am given the liberty to teach my class as I see appropriate and with no micromanagement from the college.  It makes for a rewarding teaching experience.
cons: Human resources is very slow to respond to employee issues.  They do not readily resolve mistakes and, in many cases, they will not resolve them at all without a formal process to do so.  Each employee must be prepared to go the distance with their concerns because little to nothing is resolved promptly or efficiently.

pros: Flexible hours, slow work environment, usually quiet.
cons:
Managers play favorites. Doesn’t matter how smart you are or if you’re more qualified. Managers are also degrading and resistant to change, would rather print 300+ pages than use ctrlF. The only way to advance or get a raise after years of work is if you’re related to someone. 

Part timers do not get paid holidays but are required to take 2 weeks off for winter break. Other holidays are also unpaid such as Thanksgiving for a week and other minor holidays. While this is a nice break, it’s a terrible pay cut. 

Employees are rude and do nothing but gossip. It’s like being in high school again.

review_title: Poor atmosphere, poorer leadership, noncompetitive pay/benefits
job_title: Instructional Support Specialist in Houston, TX
pros: Job Security is second to none. It seems you can get away with anything here as no one ever gets fired as it is technically a government job. Their locations allow you to work anywhere in the greater Houston area with the exception of telecommuting.
cons: Since security is so assured, no one bothers to make other's work easier. Bare minimums all around. Pay is absolutely the worst compared to the other two community colleges in the area. The Leadership including the board of trustees have been found embezzling and unethical practices as well for the past few years. Have been in the news recently as well about it.

job_title: Enrollment Service Assistant in Houston, TX
pros:
you can be a full time student while being able to work.
HCCS allowed me to study as I was working.
great pay rate
was allowed to transfer to different campuses closer to home.
depending on the department you are working for, they will always make accommodations for you.
they will rehire you if you have been great employee.
cons:
part time is strictly 19.5 hours, you will get reprimanded if you surpass your hours for the week.
no paid holidays of course, so winter/spring break be prepared to budget your bills to make it through those months of not working.
very difficult to get a full time job as it is very demanding, i know of people working for more than 5+ years and they never could get a full time job.
favoritism within HCCS is prevalent and closely ties with nepotism.

pros: As a full time faculty member, having almost a solid 4 months off every year is nice. Benefit package is good. HCC has a new chancellor. He has a real mess on his hands.
cons: Like anywhere there's good and bad. Surrounded by unqualified and/or uninspired teachers, management, staff and administration who all coast through their jobs. No one does more than they need to. They do the bare minimum. There is an overwhelming disdain between departments. No one attempts to work together. Students run the asylum. They break rules with no consequence. As a teacher, I'm fed up. This is probably going to be my last contract with HCC. There is no tenure for teaching faculty. You are handed a one year contract every May that covers the next school year. Every faculty member receives the same contract. You must sign it or you will be fired. There is no room for negotiation. Take it or leave it.

review_title: Great College... Terrible Leadership and Culture
pros: The students and the time off.
cons: HCC has a culture of ignoring problems and promoting bad behavior.  For example,  if a manager, Director, Dean, etc does something egregious,  they punish the offended employee by moving them and nothing happens to the offender. People are allowed to do whatever they want. They bully each other, yell, curse, ignore students, lie, steal, and cheat and are still able to keep their jobs. It shameful, embarrassing,  and disgraceful.

pros:
The benefits are good. If you are single your health insurance is covered by the college. Otherwise they will pay for part of your insurance coverage for your family. Two weeks vacation, after five years you get a third, and after 20 years of service you get a fourth. There is a retirement program through TRS. Other additional retirement savings plans are offered such as 457. 

There is additional time off when the college is closed. Such as major holidays and "bank holidays", as well as two weeks off in the winter and a week off for spring break. 

Since the organization is so large there is most likely some department that could fit your skill set. 

Helping strengthen the economic health of the community through affordable and accessible education.
cons:
Politics in all its forms. Poor leadership and poor oversight. We have a chancellor who is the chief executive in charge of the college's affairs and decisions, but there is also a publicly elected board that isn't always productive or responsible. 

There are a lot of mid-level managers that were socially promoted. Either because they've been with the college so long they felt the person "deserved" a higher position. Or the classic ingratiation to your superiors. There are some perfectly competent people in leadership, but there are too many that are under-skilled in their role and thus offer no valid direction for the day to day operation of the college. Which is what middle managers basically do here or anywhere. Basically we have a talent issue, and an accountability issue. 

The payscales are also below market. Or at least the offers are below market. So its impossible to get raises on merit. Its also difficult to negotiate salaries when you're hired. They often won't budge on the offer, unless your hiring manager is advocating for you. This is also why they have a hard time attracting talented people. For this reason you need a bit of altruism to know that you're not there for the money and people in the community really do need your help.

review_title: A growing and learning opportunity with great support from others around me!
pros:
Retirement package
Versatility of method
Competent
Friendly
They work with their employees to educate them and help them deal with any administrative issues that might arise.

Class sizes can be large.
Can't always get full hours (19.5 hrs)

cons: To consider the choice of teaching as an adjunct a secured full or part time job must exist. Unless the professor is satisfied with 10 years of no promotions, no security or academic growth other than what he/she would hustle.

cons: There was a policy in place that would not allow part time workers in the Testing Department to work 20 hours per week. The maximum amount of hours allowed per week was 19.5.

cons: Not many opportunities to learn new things, management doesn't communicate with lower level employees, training is non-existent

review_title: Need Better Management and HR Support for Employees

Definitely working with other employees throughout the college environment
Decent work schedules (Should all employees to do alternate work weeks like 4/10 or 9/80)
cons: Poor executive management (Bullying and very abusive to subordinate employees) - Specifically in the Institutional Advancement and Planning along with Entrepreneurial Divisions. Staff have no expectation of receiving protection from retaliation.

job_title: Student Services Assistant in Houston, TX
pros: Flexible scheduling, consistent pay, lenient dress code, a great way to develop costumer services skills. There is always work so the day moves faster.
cons: There isn't a lot of Cons, the only thing is that it's rare to get a pay increase, and the increase is based on the department. Maybe there is an increase every three years, also when there is high enrollment some of the students can cause very stressful situations. Lastly it's also very difficult to move up.

review_title: Houston Community College is a great place to offers professional and personal growth opportunities for all employees.
pros: A close knit family environment. Houston Community College is a great place to offers professional and personal growth opportunities for all employees.
cons: With the economy down, positions have been done away with and hours for part time and temporary employees at HCC have been cut.

pros: Great place to learn and make connections with the community.  Pay for middle executives is very good.
cons: The strategic plan is meaningless.  Overall direction keeps changing.  Decisions are made over and over again.  Nothing sticks.  Senior executives keep turning over.  Those that remain are not competent.  The good executives leave.  The incompetent executives stay.  Hours worked are excessive.

review_title: I like my job here to much! Job >>> School
pros: Not difficult work, dynamic environment. Sometimes it's just office support other times it's high intensity program development. There is also tons of room to move with in the College both horizontal & vertical depending on your career goals & motivations.
cons: The politics aren't difficult to navigate but they do exist. So if you hate that kind of environment you'll do fine here because it isn't over bearing.

review_title: Great professional development opportunities for faculty
pros: I have been able to grow as a teacher at HCC because there are so many opportunities to learn about new instructional methods.
cons: I have been working as an adjunct for many years, with no opportunity to advance to full-time.  The full-time teaching opportunities are just not there.

pros: It is a pleasant, stimulating environment. The faculty and administration are pleasant and reasonable. The students are very stimulating to work with; they come from all over the world.
cons: I am on an adjunct instructor, and therefore don't make much money. I teach composition, so grading fifty essays every couple of weeks gets a bit old since students make the same mistakes semester after semester.

pros: Employees are off on all National Holidays and during the spring break. Depending on your position, you may have several downtimes during the week. Therefore you can study at work if you are a student. People are friendly, caring, and courteous with each other. Minorities are very represented.
cons: It is tough to get promoted, to be hired for another position, or to change to a full-time job when you are a part-timer.

pros: The benefits are reduced tuition for HCC classes, tuition reimbursement for external coursework, medical and dental insurance, 401k retirement plan, also in the process of major, badly needed changes across the whole system
cons: Nepotism, cronyism, corruption at higher levels, ineffectual management, interdepartmental gossip, the HR department has a reputation for cruelty and indifference that gets worse as it goes higher up --evil that qualifies for a Hollywood documentary

pros: Great job security. Good facilities. Good benefits. Pay is good after you have been there a while.
cons: Many students are unmotivated. (Motivating them is part of the job - let them know you care - this works with some students but not with many.)

review_title: Decent place to work at, but salaries are not competitive
job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Houston, TX
pros:
Excellent benefits and 2 months time off in a year owing to college holidays (spring & winter break)
Pleasant work environment
cons:
Lots of red tape & bureaucracy.
Upper Management is clueless about the technical nature of IT projects, but still take technical decisions.
Projects move very slowly

review_title: There is no additional pay and it's only part/time.
pros: I LOVE working with the students and flexible hours. Working with my program manager is a delight. He constantly tells me he's glad to have me. That makes me feel welcomed.
cons: It's part-time, same pay as adjunct professor, and you cannot work more than 19.5 hours. HCC as a whole is unorganized. I had to wait six months before I had access to the teacher's lounge.

review_title: For the most part, it has been positive due to positive relationships with most employees.
pros: Positive relationships with most employees and supervisors, benefits are good, pay is comparable to other colleges, and opportunities for professional development.
cons: Supervisors do not give enough feedback (positive or negative), communication problems (not being able to get essential information efficiently, students can be rude and disrespectful

review_title: There's a Reason They Call it Grunt Work
pros: Easy pace, lots of autonomy, as an adjunct, I'm free to pick and choose which classes fit my schedule, easy extra income.
cons: Not a lot of direction given. I never actually met my supervisor, was interviewed over the phone and went directly to HR for paperwork, then everything else was by email.

review_title: Cool coworkers, easy job, but low pay
pros: Cool coworkers, easy to go along with. Flexible schedule for part time. Accommodated my class schedule. Every boss was good to work under.
cons: No advancement without a B.S.; salary for assistants is almost minimum wage. Even though I thought I did outstanding job, I was paid same as people doing very little.

pros: To describe Houston Community College, I would use, Great and Awsome!  This school does not treat you like a number, you actually count as a student.  Your questions and concerns become theirs.
cons: The Cons would be, not enough students enrolled therefore several classes end up being cancelled due to low enrollment. This is bad when a class you need to graduate keeps getting cancelled.

review_title: Good Place to work, but limited opportunities for growth
pros: It was great to work with a diverse population of students. I also enjoyed the flexibility of the position. I made my own schedule each semester. The supervisor was an excellent leader and collaborative partner
cons: The part-time position was grant funded and ended after the funding was no longer available. Also, there were few opportunities to work for the college long-term.

review_title: Professional environment with a wealth of resources.
pros: Professional environment, friendly hardworking staff at all levels, excellent facility. Excellent variety of resources available to staff for accomplishing work objectives.
cons: Must be proactive in researching and obtaining information needed to complete tasks or assignments.  Do not be afraid to over communicate.

review_title: You get what you put in
pros: Lots of people from very different backgrounds and life experiences. Many different campuses all around houston, each with a different vibe and pace. New buildings and locations being added.
cons: Management could use work, some of the financial decisions made no sense in the short or long term. Each campus seemed like a separate kingdom ruled by the different campus managers.

review_title: Good Experience to Produce Your Own Work, Management Needs Some Work
pros: real-world work experience in the news room, develop interview and editing skills, name is credited on all stories that you produce
cons: out-dated equipment, graphic and video skills of supervisors aren't well developed, high turnover rate, no room to advance, no pay raises

review_title: Feel in love with my co-workers. The atmosphere in the office was extremely positive and professional.
pros: Great atmosphere and they are always are willing to work with your schedule. Definitely a great place to work for.
cons: Some departments don’t have enough staff members. This stretches everyone thin and makes it challenging to complete daily tasks and assignments.

review_title: Rewarding and challenging position that broadened my knowledge, skills, and abilities in Adult Education
pros: Minimum supervision and autonomy to use creative license within policies and state guidelines
cons: Ineffective and poor follow-up between management and subordinates that result in missed deadlines.

review_title: Awesome  place to study, but also a great place to get a job as a student.
pros: Great staff, everybody is very supportive of each other. Working as an office assistant at the health and mental counseling office, i learn a big deal about privacy, confidentiality and data entry.
cons: the wage is minimum and also there is not a lot of advancement opportunities.

pros: I like having such talented colleagues to learn from  and most are very helpful in sharing teaching styles.
cons: The student groups can vary from each semester and either are the best in willingness to learn or apathetic to their learning experience.

job_title: Human Resources Representative in Houston, TX
pros: Paid time off, work-life balance, great benefits
cons: Low pay, treatment of non-exempt employees is not the same as exempt employees; work is not very challenging; it's difficult to move around or be promoted.

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in Houston, TX
pros: Working with the students is great! Being able to help and provide them with a means of going to school and getting an education!! Campus stays busy so it makes the day go by faster! Team building environment!!
cons: My commute is a bit far so an 8 hour day is easily a 10 or 11 hour day!!

pros: Kind and understanding management, clean and orderly work environment, some good co workers
cons: For my position, not the best training/instructional support; inter-departmental community not the best.

pros: Friendly environment, it's a good place to build up your resume. If you have a degree and you was doing well, you can get apply for higher position in the same department​
cons: Sometimes having to deal with bad students. Some of them have no interest to go to classes and don't care much about homework, tests or deadline.

pros: Days off for holidays, and training is good.
cons: Management plays favoritism with its employees. Everyone is so distanced they do not listen to employees. The supervisors talk about each other their is no brotherhood or integrity. Definitely not a police department. Very unprofessional compared to other agencies I worked for that's why I left.

pros: HCC promotes programs for the future involving the community and the ISD systems. These relationships provide excellant information for future students.
cons: Sometimes there is a miss communication no fault to HCC some ISD's are not on a calendar that matches with community needs and ISD's.

review_title: science tutoring. helping students and teach them to understand the materials especially in math and physics
pros: to gain more experience. i had worked in houston community college in trio program for many years (3 to 4 years). i had been able to deal with many different people thinking.
cons: in dealing with different students who they have different thinking

pros: HCC students are wonderful - I love teaching them.
cons: Due to budget issues, I've been moved from part time to full time and back to part time. The fact that I'm great at what I do and work hard makes no difference when it comes to job stability.

review_title: Not a Great Place to Work But At Least You Know You Will Have a Job in 5 Years
pros: Job security, Benefits, time off
cons: No sense of urgency, low tier employees, requests for anything usually take 1-2 months sometimes longer, political, low employee morale, executives are grossly overpaid, waste tax payer's money

review_title: It was nice for a bit
pros: The kids can make it either the best or worst. The location is awesome and if your in the right area it feels like home.
cons: The kids and some of the administration make life very difficult and can drive you crazy but it’s all about finding which department suits you

pros:
The manager of the Learning Emporium is very nice. 
She let me choose the working hour to fit my classes' schedule, which was pretty chaotic.
cons: The hiring process was pretty long and complicated as I am an international student.

pros: Great environment, hours, benefits are not bad, and plenty of time off.
cons: No chance to advance, under pay, under utilize your skills, no bonus, politics, and employees have not voice.

pros: I am left alone to create and teach my classes as I see fit.
cons: Salaries are embarrassingly low.

review_title: Could be better. Easy work. Easy to get lazy.
job_title: IT Project Senior Analyst in Houston, TX
pros: Very laid back environment. Pay is decent, market value. Work is easy, sometimes too easy.
cons: Just need to be better organized as an IT department. There is potential there, but too many personal agendas. A lot of nepotism and favoritism. However, again it has potential.

review_title: The people are great, easy going and the environment is very chill. Great place to work at.
pros:
-Great environment
-Understanding supervisors
-Holidays off
-Opportunity to grow
-Learn peoplesoft and meet people
cons:
-No paid holidays
-Limited hours for work
-Little promotions, but understandable.
-Sallary a little low

pros: Stable employment with flexible scheduling options. Several campuses to choose from in the greater Houston region and surrounding suburbs.
cons: No increase in salary or pay for 10+ years; One job title may require employee to work with several departments and managers in the system. The online system requires several access passcodes.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Houston, TX
pros: The students, some of the staff
cons: The pay, outdated equipment in some campuses

pros:
2 weeks off at Christmas
1 week off at Spring Break
Lots of internal training opportunities
cons: Faculty pay not as high as other local colleges

review_title: HCC - a great place to teach
pros:
1. The work is rewarding
2. The people are easy to work with
3. The pay is okay.
4. The hours are great
cons: Great place to teach - No idea what administrative jobs are like.

job_title: Financial Aid Representative in Houston, TX
pros: Three weeks paid vacation over Christmas and Spring breaks.
cons: Racist; biases; unfair treatment of Caucasian employees.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Spring Branch, TX
pros: I 'm a great Arabic for Beginners teacher , my reviews ,  students survey and Chair of the department assessment all prove  and confirm this
cons: Nothing more than it is a part time job, and I need a full time position .

job_title: Academic Advisor in Spring Branch, TX
pros: -People are very very laid back.
cons:
-Upper management are generally incompetent.  Mainly academics in charge of a department who have zero understanding of budgeting.  
-There are zero optimization protocols for the institution.
-Very low self-service systems for students
-Low pay

review_title: Adjunct Faculty Intensive ESL English Teacher
pros: It is a pleasure to work with the biggest Houston City College, it is lots of fun to work with International students from all over the world.
cons: Finding parking spots might be challenging at least some of the days of the week.

pros:
Family culture
Caring 
Average salary
Flexible schedule
Good values
cons:
Overtime they should give out more over time. 
Salary is average I wished it was a bit higher.

review_title: Supportive administration, freedom to implement new methods of teaching
pros: Supportive administration, excellent professional development, and progressive digital technologies in  the classroom.  I love teaching and Houston College College has given me the opportunity to grow as a teacher.
cons: Budget constraints limit full time opportunities

pros: The IT department, as well as, the CIO are very supportive and encouraging. They offer training for anything and try to incorporate your input as much as possible.
cons: It's a community college so of course things move slower, but it's to be expected.

job_title: Campus Technology Technician in Houston, TX
pros: Good health insurance and benefits
cons: One of the most toxic environments I've ever worked in, with much lower than average pay. Still reeling from a major restructuring, people are being shuffled around to different campuses. Additionally, and specific to IT, the management is extremely cheap and prefers easy, low-cost bandaid solutions to problems. Most of the equipment is very outdated and nearly impossible to maintain. Also, not a welcoming or friendly environment.

job_title: Instructional Support Specialist in Houston, TX
pros:
Friendly and open working environment.  Flexible with schedules and needed time off.
co-workers and staff are always willing to help and support each other.
cons: Only part time positions available for this position and often too few hours offered per month.

job_title: Office and Teaching Assistant in Houston, TX
pros: flexible and friendly co-workers with challenging student group to teach
cons: low pay, management faithful to employees to a fault - there are some current employees whose poor quality of work affects others regularly and they are not reprimanded for it

pros: The Mathematics Department is a very supportive and friendly place to work.
cons: Some senior administrators are unwilling to consider the view from inside the trenches.

job_title: College Success Academic/Tutor Coordinator in Richmond, TX
pros:
multicultural diversity environment very inspiring and motivational for students and staff.
best benefits available,
cons: pay not very lucrative, to some extent there is discrimination.

pros: Great benefits and holiday pay. Great salary with yearly increase. Work hours are flexible.
cons: HR is corrupted, supervisors and upper management discriminates ...Hiring process is corrupt,  supervisors hire people they know.

job_title: Manager, Financial Aid Student Success in Houston, TX
pros: Loved working with students helping them find funding to pay for college.
cons:
Company Culture very laid back/less accountability 
Having to tell a student "no" when he/she is not eligible to receive federal assistance due to high income.

pros: Friendly, easy to get along with staff.
cons: Long driving distance.  Some satellite campuses very difficult to find.

review_title: Good place if you want to retire from it
pros: Many benefits except for the "Cons" below
cons: HR dept is very, very slow and non-responsive

job_title: Community Engagement Representative in Houston, TX
pros:
Very Team oriented and Fast-paced.
 they have a very strong comradery and are very courteous and respect each other. 
A great work environment.
 Very creative group and flexible.
cons: fast-paced, and can be overwhelming at times.

review_title: More political than a presidential election;
pros: The opportunities are there for a while.
cons: The opportunities change with the constantly changing management.

review_title: Must be more passionate teaching than making money
job_title: Adjunct Cosmetology Instructor in Houston, TX
pros: Good experience, hours are minimal, not too hard work and necessary training
cons: Not fulltime, no health benefits, semester contract, no work in between semesters

pros: Great Benefits, Friendly co-workers.  Fantastic vacation time.
cons: Upper management does not have a clue how the lower members of staff are treated.

review_title: Great experience, flexible hours for students.
job_title: Customer Service in South Houston, TX
pros: You get to work with different people from all around the world. Learning experience great net working.
cons: Things may change from one day to another.

review_title: Pleasant in the beginning, terrible at the end
job_title: Professor- Coleman College of Health Sciences in Houston, TX
pros: A good place to gain experience in the teaching field.
cons: POLITICS! Co-workers who go behind your back to scheme. Top management never keeps their word in regards to pay. HCC just wants to pay you as little as you will ALLOW them to.

pros: If you are attending school and want a relaxed position a great position for students.
cons: It's difficult to get into higher positions unless you are close to those in managerial positions.

job_title: Intensive English Coordinator in Houston, TX
pros: A pleasurable place to work at many different experiences.
cons: You just need to find the correct location to work at so that you never have problems with travel.

review_title: Houston Community College review for part time employees
pros: great management and pay are good
cons: the Part time Staff do not get paid well and provide that level of service.

pros: Great community, love the students and the organization as a whole
cons: Maybe work on Department Organization a bit more

pros: decent supplemental income and experience

pros: There are Great Opportunities within the academic field.

review_title: Very hard to advance or change departments unless you know someone
pros: Probably the benefits is the only good thing here

pros: Great place to work. Wonderful Staff. Worked in Continuing Education Department. I would recommend it for part-time.

pros: Good place to work for
